TextView.android:text: SELF-INSPECTION CHECKLIST FOR PHARMACIES (WHOLESALE PHARMACIES /IMPORTERS/DISTRIBUTORS)

(This checklist is a Quality assurance tool by the Council to improve, standardize and institutionalize the practice of Pharmacy in Uganda. Council through its regular inspection and surveillance programme will be verifying the details indicated. The supervising Pharmacists shall fill these forms at least twice a year and submit a copy to PSU. Wholesale and Retail Pharmacies have to fill both Wholesale and retail self-inspection checklists separately)
Pharmacy Name
Pharmacist Name
Registration Number
Date of Self-Inspection
Duration of existence of pharmacy
Type of pharmacy
Is there a valid Certificate of Practice for the Pharmacist?
Does the Pharmacy have a valid license from NDA?
Are both documents prominently displayed on the Premises?
Is the Pharmacist Present at the stipulated times?
Are drugs handled only by persons qualified in medicines?
Is there an internal training programme for the technical staff?
Are there records for attendance times for the technical staff?
Are written job descriptions available for all technical staff?
Does the process of recruitment of technical staff measure staff competency?
Are employee training files kept?
Do all the technical employees both temporary and permanent have appointment letters?
Is the Pharmacistsâ€™ advice taken by management?
Do the staff in the Pharmacy have identification tags with titles?
Do the staff hold regular technical review meetings on improving the quality of service?
Have the sales and medical representatives undergone the sales and medical representatives training by PSU
Type of pharmacy
Premises and layout
Does the Pharmacist have a designated suitable sitting area in the Pharmacy?
Does it allow for the Pharmacist to easily monitor the activities?
Are premises cleaned daily and cleaning records maintained?
Storage ,Procurement and Supply of Medicines
Are medicines stored as per their storage requirements?
Is there a temperature and relative humidity monitoring device for recording the temperatures within the pharmacy and stores?
Are there records kept to capture the expiry dates of the stock?
Is there a dedicated area for placement of expired drugs?
Are the storage areas for the medicines raised above the floor?
Does the Pharmacist have access to the storage area?
Is the storage area inspected regularly?
Are the other persons having access to the storage area authorized by the Pharmacists
Are the storage areas cleaned frequently?
Is there a screening system of ensuring that drugs are only supplied to licensed drug outlets? (attach details)
Are records of sales made to the various drug outlets maintained including the batch numbers supplied?
Does the Pharmacist approve all purchases of medicines?
Does the Pharmacy have a list of approved suppliers
Is stock taking done at least once a year and reconciled with sales and receipts?
Does the storage area have pest controls?
Is there a quality policy or manual on Pharmaceuticals?
Are there Standard Operating Procedures(SOPs) for the following
Counterfeit detection of medicines in the market?
Distribution of medicines
Receipt, Storage and handling of medicines
Sourcing of medicines and pre-qualification of suppliers?
Expiry date checking?
Storage and record keeping for controlled drugs?
Disposal and destruction of expired medicines?
Complaint handling and Recall of Medicines
In-house Sampling and testing of distributed medicines from the market regularly?
Housekeeping and Personal hygiene?
Is there an implementation date for all SOPs?
Is there a review date for all SOPs?
Is there evidence that staff have been trained on SOPs?
Is there a duty register for technical staff?
Are the following reference books/communications available
British National Formulary( BNF) for Adults /Veterinary formulary
British National Formulary(BNF) for Children(Human)
Uganda Clinical Guidelines (Human)
Is there a file of communications from PSU/NDA?
Is there a medical dictionary available?
Professional services
Are the technical Pharmacy staff dressed in clean uniforms labeled with clear designations?
